13.desc: This is the worst company I've ever been at and I'm sad to leave because it actually pays decent.
13.pros: TikTok is a company that pays a lot, but that's about it.
13.cons: Probably missing a few cons, since there are so many!I'm not sure if it's like this in other orgs, but the org is completely mismanaged, with 90+ employees falling under the person.  The company's push for a flat org simply does not work well--at least not in the team that I'm in.  It leads to a complete lack of accountability instead.  Nobody takes notes during meetings, action items are forgotten immediately after each call and there is no follow through.  Random people are added to meetings, making the duration of the calls excessive, especially if they start talking.  Often, it's not even a topic that they understand or should be speaking about.  Also, large meetings are scheduled when it's something that can be hashed out in 5 minutes.  It's possible that this is a way for them to let everyone know that they are doing work.TikTok takes on the China culture of throwing bodies at problems, rather than working on improving processes.The processes are so inflexible that we have no choice but to throw more bodies at problems.95%+ of the people on my team are incapable of performing their role effectively.  It's either from a lack of work ethics, or just doesn't understand the subject.  Do we not actually interview new hires or something? I've never worked at a company where there is this much incompetence stacked together.
13.resignation reason: This is the worst run company I've ever been to and I don't see it getting any better.  Each day that passes, I see the ship sinking more and more.  In order for it to be a good company, we need a complete overhaul.
13.authorInfo: Verified User Former Employee  L******  Infrastructure Engineer - May 2, 2022

A Sunday and a Tuesday next week. 6/7 day in a row work weeks are commonplace.- 6 month probation period, during which 70% of the team has been fired by the supervisor while they were sick or on holidays. The HR guy didn't even bother to inform them.- During the job interview, the senior recruiter lies about possibilities in the company. But you have to wait out the 6 month probation period. After this, you're told there are none. End of the line here.- Supervisor is incompetent beyond belief. Supervisors work hours are roughly from 11 to 18:00 hours. 99% of the team arrives at 16:00 and stays till 01:00. Who exactly are you supervising then? Doesn't take the effort to get to know anyone, only communicates with favorites. Doesn't know the very basics of the work we do after being on the job 6 months.- Supervisor intimidates and lashes out at anyone who dares to be critical. Does not have any sense of self-criticism. Blames the whole world. Needs to be told by lower-ranking team members how to do job.- Constant lies about reasons for radical changes or why there isn't any new staff hired to take the pressure off the workload. Blame is always put on China, where in fact only the local supervisor decides these things.- As the office in which its located doesn't have staff operating after 17:00 the air-condition is either off and leaves it smelling like a dump or on freezer mode and leaves everyone sick. Windows can't be opened. Dishes aren't done during the weekends; toilets smell like a sewer.- Pay is terrible, especially considering the toll it takes on personal health and family life.
316.resignation reason: - People who don't add any value are kept and paid extremely well, such as a supervisor who doesn't work the same hours as the team that is supposed to be supervised! - The supervisor that cannot actually supervise us, because she is never there when we work, then invents jobs like team-leader to compensate for this. It's the supervisor's job to supervise, not anyone else's.- People who do the work well are fired left right and center, and then the management wonders why morale is low. 427.desc: Think twice if you want to join when you are non-Chinese (see below on who will be successful in this company)
427.pros: [Pros]* Compensation is comparable to top tech companies.* Very popular product with a lot of potential.* Fast paced with a broad scope. An opportunity to learn about multiple components.
427.cons: [Summary] In my opinion, here's what you need to have in order to be successful in engineering at ByteDance/TikTok.If you are:* Chinese AND* speak mandarin AND* want to actively work with colleagues from China after hours AND* are currently in top tech company (Google, Facebook, etc.)THEN: joining ByteDance might be a good move for you. It's possible you'll have larger scope and/or better role than what you have now.For everyone else - you will probably find a better job elsewhere.[Cons]* The work of US teams is very strongly tied to the work of teams in China. This is true at both decision making/approval and low-level engineering work. In both cases there needs to be extensive collaboration. As a result, expect the following.    * Work-life balance can vary between different orgs, but, very likely, it's going to be bad. Due to time zone difference it means work out of US work hours.    * Expect language and cultural barrier if you don't speak mandarin. The level of speaking English in China teams can vary, but for engineers it's usually bad. Meetings are sometimes held in mandarin.* Company culture is very closed. The information is not shared broadly if at all.* Management, in the US, at least, can be not very mature.

505.cons: 1. Management is trying, but everything is still confusing, what are they really trying?The job scope isn't defined, the same team members might have a differing scope of work. 2. What culture?Tiktok plays a good game with wording the company culture and holds quarterly competition on what the company values are, and we are scored on our culture in our performance review. But I do not see this culture practiced anywhere, other than in times when people wants to reach out to you jumping over his team leads, and their counterparts etc. 3. Career growth is sketchyNo promotion = no increment. No increment then are you really growing your career? 4.
